description: On March 20 the Security and Intelligence Service of the Republic of Moldova decided executive measures for eliminating COVID-19 related misinformation. Internet providers will cease the access to fake news websites during the state of emergency.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From March 27, the providers of media services in Moldova will be obliged to broadcast information about COVID-19 exclusively from mandatorily verified sources, by mandatorily presenting the position of the competent pubic authorities.

Moldova's Ministry of Health, Labor and Social Protection (in partnership with the Office of the World Health Organization of the Republic of Moldova and the UN Office for Human Rights), has launched a campaign to help combat the social stigmatization of people who are infected with, have recovered from or work with those who have COVID-19.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The movement of citizens through the town of Sângerei, Moldova, will be restricted, in particular after 10pm between March 21 and April 1.

On March 16, The Parliament of Moldova declared a State of Emergency allowing the government to impose additional border controls, limit movement, prohibit large gatherings, manage food supplies, and coordinate media messaging about the pandemic. It will end in 60 days.
A state of emergency was declared in the Transnistrian region of Moldova. It will last from March 17 until April 5.
A state of emergency was declared in the Transnistrian region of Moldova. It will last from March 17 until April 5. It is extended on April 24 until May 15.
A state of emergency was declared in the Transnistrian region of Moldova. It will last from March 17 until April 5. On March 30, it was extended until May 1.

The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

On July 24 the Commission extended the state of public health emergency to August 31.

The public health emergency has again been extended to September 15, 2020 by the National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova.

The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

This state of Public health emergency will now continue to remain in effect until September 30

The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency between May 16 and June 30. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.
Moldova suspends air traffic with Italy as of March 12. The measure is valid until March 31.

The National Extraordinary Commission on Public Health eased restrictions by decree on 15 May, 2020 to allow passengers of any nationality transit through Moldovan territory on repatriation journeys organized by their home countries. As of May 25, 2020 The National Extraordinary Commission on Public Health have fully lifted all restrictions on passengers transiting Moldova.

description: Air operators are banned from carrying persons of other nationalities than Moldovan to Moldova from March 13, except for stateless persons and foreigners with residence, domicile or with permit of stay in Moldova.
The Republic of Moldova closes its airspace for the regular flights from Spain and France as of March 13. The Chisinau-Barcelona and Chisinau-Paris flights are also annulled.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The Republic of Moldova closes its airspace for the regular flights from Spain and France as of March 13. The Chisinau-Barcelona and Chisinau-Paris flights are also annulled.

Flights to and from all destinations are permitted to resume from June 15, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of March 17th, 2020 Moldova restricted its air and land borders to admit Moldovan citizens only (with exceptions for foreigners legally residing in Moldova, commercial vehicle operators and crew, accredited diplomatic staff or representatives of international organizations or missions and their family members. Further exceptions to be decided by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration).
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: Moldova stopped flights at the Chisinau Airport from March 17 until May 15, at the earliest. This suspends all inbound and outbund flights from the country.

As of March 17th, 2020 Moldova restricted its air and land borders to admit Moldovan citizens only (with exceptions for foreigners legally residing in Moldova, commercial vehicle operators and crew, accredited diplomatic staff or representatives of international organizations or missions and their family members. Further exceptions to be decided by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration).  

In the most recent update to the border restrictions (July 24), only Moldovan citizens may continue to enter Moldova freely, with exceptions for foreign citizens who are: relatives of Moldovan citizens, non-citizen residents and long-term visa holders, business travellers (with appropriate visas), diplomatic staff or staff of international organizations or missions and their family members, transiting passengers, persons travelling for health or humanitarian reasons (with appropriate documents), cross-border workers, and operators and crew of commercial vehicles.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: Citizens of the de facto Transnistria holding residence permits issued after June 3, 2020 who live in territory claimed by Transnistria, but currently under the administration of the Moldovan Government at Chisinau, must receive special permission to cross into Transnistrian territory from the Transnistrian Ministry of Internal Affairs' Operational Headquarters for the Prevention and Prevention of the Spread of Viral Infection. The areas subject to this requirement are:  the village of Varnitsa; the village of Kopanka, Slobodzeya region; the villages of Novaya Molovata, Kociery, Pogrebea, Dorotskoe , Koshnitsa, Pyryta, Dubossary region.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

On March 12, Moldova will receive 1,000 COVID-19 tests from the World Health Organization.
The Ministry of Justice of Moldova donated 45,000 protective masks to the Chisinau Emergency Medicine Institute on March 19.
The National Medical Insurance Company in Moldova will provide 2,000,000 lei for the purchase of 640,000 medical gloves and 250,000 medical masks.
The National Medical Insurance Company in Moldova will provide 2,000,000 lei for the purchase of 640,000 medical gloves and 250,000 medical masks.
Moldova received on March 24 another 1,000 COVID-19 test kits from WHO.

Doctors and medical assistants from ten districts in Moldova will receive masks, around 100,000 gloves and 760 liters of disinfectant from the Swiss Cooperation Office in the country on between March 25 and March 31.

description:
The Ministry of Finance in Moldova announced on March 31 to allocate 
the amount of 5.4 million lei, to the Ministry of Health for procuring protective coveralls.
The Chisinau, Moldova, COVID-19 Center in the Exhibitions Center “Moldexpo” will become functional on April 3. At the first stage, this will have a capacity of 300-400 places.

description: On April 3, the Exceptional Situations Commission in Moldova took the decision to purchase tests for COVID-19 infection, worth 35.5 million lei, money allocated by the National Medical Insurance Company.

The authorities in Moldova decided on April 6 to massively test all the doctors in Stefan-Voda and Soroca. The doctors in the rest of the regions, from all the medical institutions, will be tested later, gradually.

description: Each housing stock manager in Chisinau, Moldova, is obliged to sanitize balustrades, stairs and elevators in apartments twice a day and playgrounds each morning from March 13. The workers are issued with protective face masks and gloves.
The managers and owners of passenger transportation companies in Moldiva are to ensure from March 13 the cleaning and disinfection of the motor vehicles after each route.

The new parliamentary elections that will take place in Hince<U+0219>ti, Moldova, on March 15 will be held in conditions of increased protection and sanitation. Antiseptics will be available in polling stations and the members of electoral bureaus will wear medical face masks. The number of voters inside a polling station will be limited.
The Chisinau City Hall in Moldova said that as of March 20, hand sanitizer dispensers will be available in all the trolleybuses running on routes in the capital city.
Transnistria, Moldova, bans from March 17 the entrance of non-residents of the region, except for diplomats and those who transport food products and other essentials.

description: From March 17, residents of the Transnistrian region in Moldova will be able to leave after filling out a mandatory form.

description: On March 21 and 22, the public transport in the municipality of Chisinau, Moldova will run on routes from 7am until 10am and then from 4pm until 7:30pm only.

description: The transit transport in Chisinau, Moldova, has a new work program as of March 23. The trolleybuses and buses will run from 5:30am until 10:00am and then from 4:00pm until 8:00pm.

description: From 8 am on April 14th, Moldova placed the town of Glodeni into quarantine. This is on top of quarantines placed on Soroca municipality, Boghiceni village of Hânce<U+0219>ti district, <U+0218>tefan Voda town, Carahasani and Talmaza villages of <U+0218>tefan Voda district.

description: The town Sângerei in Moldova will be in lockdown from March 21 until April 1.

Access through the town of Sângerei, Moldova, is restricted between March 21 and April 1. Only the persons who need to make purchases and need the services of the Public Services Agency are an exception.
The government of the Transnistria region in Moldova have suspended the operation of all public transport beginning March 24.

The government of the Transnistria region in Moldova have suspended the operation of all public transport beginning March 24. 

As part of the gradual easing of lockdown restrictions, public transport will be permitted to operate freely within the Transnistrian region beginning June 27th.
From March 25 it is forbidden to persons over 63 years of age in Moldova to be away from home and in public spaces without urgent need except for medicine and grocery shopping.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: The clients and employees of hypermarkets, supermarkets and quarter stores in Chisinau, Moldova, will have their body temperature checked on entry from April 6. If the temperature is higher than 37°C, the person will be banned access to the store.
type_text: All customers and employees of supermarkets will have their temperature checked before they can enter the shop.

description: In Moldova on March 20, a new on-line platform allowing real-time monitoring of COVID-19 cases in the Republic of Moldova was launched by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Social Protection.

A platform was released for reporting violations related to the state of emergency in Moldova as of April 3. It contains free standard forms that ensure juridical guidance for those who want to inform the responsible authorities about particular abuses and web accessible resources concerning organizations who provide COVID-19 related assistance.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: The health authorities of Moldova called on the population on March 10 who returned from countries affected by COVID-19 to remain at home for 14 days and not to go to health facilities, if they do not have health problems.

The health authorities of Moldova called on the population on March 10 who returned from countries affected by COVID-19 to remain at home for 14 days and not to go to health facilities, if they do not have health problems. From May 27, this is no longer valid for people transporting goods, students, and people traveling for professional or health interests.

The Moldova Border Police will step up control measures at border crossing points and will identify mechanisms for immediately placing the persons who return from areas affected by COVID-19 in quarantine from March 11.

The Moldova Border Police will step up control measures at border crossing points and will identify mechanisms for immediately placing the persons who return from areas affected by COVID-19 in quarantine from March 11. The fines for endangering public health will oscillate between 22,000 and 25,000 lei in the case of private individuals and between 50,000 and 75,000 lei in the case of legal entities.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Residents of the Transnistrian region in Moldova who are returning into the region are from March 17 obliged to stay in home quarantine for 14 days.

From May 27, people entering Moldova excluding drivers transporting goods, crews, persons who travel for health or humanitarian reasons, students, and persons who travel for professional interests must self-isolate for 14 days.

As of August 31, 2020, persons arriving in Moldova from countries on the Moldovan Governments COVID-19 "red list," will be obliged to self-isolate for 143 days on arrival into the Republic of Moldova. The "red list" is set to be updated every two weeks and will include countries where COVID-19 infection rates are greater than 50 cases per 100,000 population.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
